info.title: Clinical Health API
info.description:
The Clinical Health API allows you to develop clinical-facing applications which pull patient demographic and health information for clinical settings. Depending on the source, data may be available in real-time or up to 48 hours after entry. There is no hold on data returned with the Clinical Health API.


If you are developing patient-facing applications, use the [Patient Health API (FHIR)](https://developer.va.gov/explore/health/docs/fhir?version=current).

 # Background 

 This API uses [HL7â€™s Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR)](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/overview.html) resources and follows the [US Core Implementation Guide](http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU4). FHIR solutions are built from a standard set of modular components called resources, which can be assembled and implemented according to a variety of methods.


# Technical overview

 The Clinical Health API allows queries that return health records in [FHIR](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/overview.html) format. It pulls resources from both [Veterans Health Information Systems and Technology Architecture (VistA)](https://www.oit.va.gov/Services/TRM/ToolPage.aspx?tid=8338) and [Corporate Data Warehouse (CDW)](https://www.hsrd.research.va.gov/for_researchers/vinci/cdw.cfm). Resources pulled from VistA are available upon entry (in real time) while resources pulled from CDW are available 24-48 hours after entry.


## Authentication and Authorization

 The Clinical Health API uses the single sign-on internal (SSOi) method of authorization, which provides an additional identifier with which authentication is performed. This method is based on OAuth 2.0 / OpenID Connect and supports the [authorization code flow](https://developer.va.gov/explore/api/clinical-health/authorization-code) using a client secret or Proof Key for Code Exchange (PKCE).


## Test Data

 The database powering our sandbox environment is populated with test patient data. [Sandbox test patients](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/vets-api-clients/blob/master/test_accounts/clinical_health_test_accounts.md) contains no PII or PHI but mimic real VA patient demographics and disease models. The associated clinical resources include data generated from disease models covering up to a dozen of the most common VA patient afflictions.

get.summary: Searches for allergy intolerances using at least one required parameter of patient or _id. (SEARCH)
get.description:
- This endpoint can return a known patient allergy related to medication, food, or other substances.
- Follows the [US Core AllergyIntolerance Profile](http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU4/StructureDefinition-us-core-allergyintolerance.html)

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: The Integration Control Number (ICN) assigned by the Master Patient Index (MPI) that refers to the patient referenced by the allergy intolerance. Either the patient or _id parameter is required.

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: The logical id of the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: The number of resources that should be returned in a single page. The maximum count size is 100.

get.summary: Returns a specific allergy intolerance based on _id. (READ)
get.description:
- This endpoint can return a known patient allergy related to medication, food, or other substances.
- Follows the [US Core AllergyIntolerance Profile](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU4/StructureDefinition-us-core-allergyintolerance.html)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The logical id of the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

get.summary: Searches for conditions using at least one required parameter of patient or _id. (SEARCH)
get.description:
- A condition may be any medical condition in the VA system.
- Chronic conditions are identified by the problem-list category code.
- Provider-given diagnoses treated during a visit are identified by the encounter-diagnosis category code.
- Data from this resource is available within 24 - 48 hours.
- Supported US Core Profiles are:
  - [US Core Condition Encounter Diagnosis Profile (STU5)](http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU5.0.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-condition-encounter-diagnosis.html)
  - [US Core Condition Problems and Health Concerns Profile (STU5)](http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU5.0.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-condition-problems-health-concerns.html)

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: The Integration Control Number (ICN) assigned by the Master Patient Index (MPI) that refers to the patient referenced by the condition. Either the patient or _id parameter is required.

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: The Condition resource FHIR _id. Either the _id or patient parameter is required. If _id is used, no other parameters can be used.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: The category the condition record belongs to. Can be used to distinguish between health concerns and problems. Supported values are encounter-diagnosis and problem-list-item.

parameters.name: clinical-status
parameters.description: Indicates the clinical state of the condition described by the record, taking prior conditions into account. Supported values are active, inactive, or resolved.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Identification of the condition, problem or diagnosis. [Condition Codes.](https://hl7.org/fhir/r4/valueset-condition-code.html)

parameters.name: encounter
parameters.description: The Encounter during which this Condition was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.

parameters.name: onset-date
parameters.description: The estimated or actual date-time of the condition.

parameters.name: recorded-date
parameters.description: Date record was first recorded.

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: The date when the record was last updated. Supported formats are: YYYY, YYYY-MM, YYYY-MM-DD, YYYY-MM-DD'T'HH:MM:SSZ [View supported prefixes.](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/search.html#prefix)

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number being requested.

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: The number of resources that should be returned in a single page. The maximum count size is 100.

parameters.name: abatement-date
parameters.description: The estimated or actual date-time that the condition resolved or went into remission.

get.summary: Returns a specific condition based on _id. (READ)
get.description:
- A condition may be any medical condition in the VA system.
- Chronic conditions are identified by the problem-list category code.
- Provider-given diagnoses treated during a visit are identified by the encounter-diagnosis category code.
- Data from this resource is available within 24 - 48 hours.
- Supported US Core Profiles are:
  - [US Core Condition Encounter Diagnosis Profile (STU5)](http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU5.0.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-condition-encounter-diagnosis.html)
  - [US Core Condition Problems and Health Concerns Profile (STU5)](http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU5.0.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-condition-problems-health-concerns.html)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The Condition resource FHIR _id.

get.summary: Returns a list of medication dispense events for a patient based on the required patient parameter. (SEARCH)
get.description:
- Describes a medication that will be or has been dispensed to a patient.
- Data from this resource is available upon entry (in real time).
- View the [FHIR MedicationDispense resource](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/medicationdispense.html)

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: The patient's Integration Control Number (ICN) assigned by the Master Patient Index (MPI).

parameters.name: whenprepared
parameters.description: Date range to filter dispenses by the date the Rx fill was prepared.

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: The number of resources that should be returned in a single page.

get.summary: Returns a single medication dispense event based on _id. (READ)
get.description:
- Describes a medication that will be or has been dispensed to a patient.
- Data from this resource is available upon entry (in real time).
- View the [FHIR MedicationDispense resource](https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/medicationdispense.html)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The logical id of the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

get.summary: Searches for medication requests based on the required patient parameter. (SEARCH)
get.description:
- Medication requests are the medications a patient is prescribed, including usage instructions.
- Data from this resource is available upon entry (in real time).
- Follows the [US Core MedicationRequest Profile (STU4)](http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU4/StructureDefinition-us-core-medicationrequest.html)

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: The patient's Integration Control Number (ICN) assigned by the Master Patient Index (MPI).

parameters.name: authoredon
parameters.description: A date range to filter requests by the date the Rx was written

parameters.name: -health-care-system
parameters.description: The Health Care System's identifying sta3n. This parameter must be specified alongside identifier.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The Health Care System's identifying oid:system|code or code. If the system is not provided, a search across all systems will be performed.

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: The number of resources that should be returned in a single page.

get.summary: Returns a specific medication request based on _id. (READ)
get.description:
- Medication requests are the medications a patient is prescribed, including usage instructions.
- Data from this resource is available upon entry (in real time).
- Follows the [US Core MedicationRequest Profile (STU4)](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU4/StructureDefinition-us-core-medicationrequest.html)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The logical id of the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

get.summary: Searches for observations using at least one required parameter of patient or _id. (SEARCH)
get.description:
- Observations can be any recorded, health-related data. This data may be indirectly related to health issues.
- Endpoint returns vital sign, screening assessment, and laboratory test data.
- Data from this resource is available upon entry (in real time).
- Supported US Core Profiles are:
  - [US Core Respiratory Rate Profile](http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU4/StructureDefinition-us-core-respiratory-rate.html)
  - [US Core Vital Signs Profile](http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU4/StructureDefinition-us-core-vital-signs.html)
  - [US Core Laboratory Result Observation Profile](http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU4/StructureDefinition-us-core-observation-lab.html)
  - [US Core Observation Screening Assessment Profile](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU6/StructureDefinition-us-core-observation-screening-assessment.html)
  - [US Core Pulse Oximetry Profile](http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU4/StructureDefinition-us-core-pulse-oximetry.html)

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: The patient's Integration Control Number (ICN) assigned by the Master Patient Index (MPI).

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: The logical id of the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The logical identifier of the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: The general classification of the type of observation. [Observation Category Codes](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/valueset-observation-category.html)

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: A code that indicates the type of information contained within the observation. [LOINC Observation Codes](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/valueset-observation-codes.html)

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: A date or range of dates (maximum of 2) that describes the date that the observation was recorded.

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: The number of resources that should be returned in a single page.

get.summary: Returns a specific observation based on _id. (READ)
get.description:
- Observations can be any recorded, health-related data. This data may be indirectly related to health issues.
- Endpoint returns vital sign, screening assessment, and laboratory test data.
- Data from this resource is available upon entry (in real time).
- Supported US Core Profiles are:
  - [US Core Respiratory Rate Profile](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU4/StructureDefinition-us-core-respiratory-rate.html)
  - [US Core Vital Signs Profile](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU4/StructureDefinition-us-core-vital-signs.html)
  - [US Core Laboratory Result Observation Profile](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU4/StructureDefinition-us-core-observation-lab.html)
  - [US Core Observation Screening Assessment Profile](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU6.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-observation-screening-assessment.html)
  - [US Core Pulse Oximetry Profile](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU4/StructureDefinition-us-core-pulse-oximetry.html)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The logical id of the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

get.summary: Returns demographic information for a patient based on the required parameter of _id or identifier. (SEARCH)
get.description:
- Returns all known demographics and other administrative information about an individual who has at least one visit to a VA site.
- Data from this resource is available within 24 - 48 hours.
- Follows the [US Core Patient Profile (STU4)](http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU4/StructureDefinition-us-core-patient.html)

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: The Integration Control Number (ICN) for the patient assigned by the VA Master Patient Index (MPI). Either the _id or identifier parameter is required.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The Patient resource FHIR _id. Additional values are supported in this field but are not used for searching. Either the identifier or _id parameter is required.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number of the search result.

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: The number of resources that should be returned in a single page. The maximum count size is 100.

post.summary: Returns a patient's ICN based on demographic information.
post.description:
- Uses demographic information to find a matching patient in the VA's Master Patient Index (MPI) and returns a patient resource/ICN.
- For a match to be found, you must pass, at minimum, the patient's first name, last name, date of birth, and address or phone number. If these parameters are not provided, a match will not be found.
- If a match is not found, an empty response is returned.
- Follows [FHIR patient operation match](http://build.fhir.org/patient-operation-match.html)
- `onlyCertainMatches` and `count` parameters are ignored, as we do not return multiple matches.
### Request Body Parameters
| **Name** | **Description** |
| --- | --- |
| `name.family` | Last name of the patient. |
| `name.given` | First or first and middle names of the patient. |
| `birthDate` | Patient's birthdate in yyyy-mm-dd format. |
| `gender` | Birthsex of the patient (male/female). |
| `address` | Street, city, state, postal code of the patient. |
| `telecom` | Home phone number of the patient. |

valueCoding.display: NATIVE HAWAIIAN OR OTHER PACIFIC ISLANDER

extension.valueString: NATIVE HAWAIIAN OR OTHER PACIFIC ISLANDER

get.summary: Returns demographic information for a single patient based on _id. (READ)
get.description:
- Returns all known demographics and other administrative information about an individual who has at least one visit to a VA site.
- Data from this resource is available within 24 - 48 hours.
- Follows the [US Core Patient Profile (STU4)](http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU4/StructureDefinition-us-core-patient.html)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The Integration Control Number (ICN) for the patient assigned by the VA Master Patient Index (MPI).

get.summary: Returns demographic information for one or more practitioners based on at least one required parameter of _id, name, given, or family. (SEARCH)
get.description:
- The practitioner resource includes any professional healthcare providers or staff and known demographic information.
- Data from this resource is available within 24 - 48 hours.
- Follows the [US Core Practitioner Profile (STU5)](http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU5.0.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-practitioner.html)

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: The Practitioner resource FHIR _id. Either the _id or identifier parameter is required. If _id is used, no other parameters can be used.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Can be an Integration Control Number (ICN) or National Provider Identifier (NPI). Example value: 1609827153.

parameters.name: family
parameters.description: The family name of the practitioner.

parameters.name: given
parameters.description: The given name of the practitioner.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The given or family name of the practitioner.

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: The date when the record was last updated. Supported formats are: YYYY, YYYY-MM, YYYY-MM-DD, YYYY-MM-DD'T'HH:MM:SSZ [View supported prefixes.](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/search.html#prefix)

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number of the search result.

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: The number of resources that should be returned in a single page. The maximum count size is 100.

get.summary: Returns demographic information for a single practitioner based on _id. (READ)
get.description:
- The practitioner resource includes any professional healthcare provider or staff member and known demographic information.
- Data from this resource is available within 24 - 48 hours.
- Follows the [US Core Practitioner Profile (STU5)](http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU5.0.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-practitioner.html)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The Practitioner resource FHIR _id.

type.description: Identification of the underlying physiological mechanism for the reaction risk.

recordedDate.description: The recordedDate represents when this particular AllergyIntolerance record was created in the system, which is often a system-generated date.

note.description: Additional narrative about the propensity for the Adverse Reaction that is not captured in other fields.

manifestation.description: Clinical symptoms and/or signs that are observed or associated with the adverse reaction event. System is urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.6.233.

example.name: API Management Platform | Example - US Core
example.title: API Management Platform | Example - US Core
example.description: Read and search support for FHIR resources.

implementation.description: API Management Platform | Example - US Core

category.description: A category assigned to the condition. [View condition category codes](http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/condition-category).

onsetDateTime.description: Estimated or actual date or date-time the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician.

recordedDate.description: Represents when this particular Condition record was created in the system, which is often a system-generated date.

Content.description: The document and format referenced. References the Binary resource.

Context.description: The clinical context in which the document was prepared. References the Encounter resource.

name.description: The name of the device as given by the manufacturer.

intent.description: Whether the request is a proposal, plan, or an original or reflex order.

occurrenceDateTime.description: The timing schedule for the use of the device.

reasonCode.description: Reason or justification for the use of this device.

DeviceRequest.description:
https://www.hl7.org/fhir/R4/devicerequest.html

**Notes**

This resource includes only CPAP and BiPAP data.

status.description: The status of this document reference.

docStatus.description: The status of the underlying document.

category.description: A categorization for the type of document referenced - helps for indexing and searching. [View US Core DocumentReference categories.](http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/ValueSet/us-core-documentreference-category)

date.description: When the document reference was created.

author.description: Identifies who is responsible for adding the information to the document. References the Practitioner resource.

content.description: The document and format referenced. References the Binary resource.

type.text: NOTE
NOTE

type.description: Specific type of encounter. Follows [CPT code system.](http://www.ama-assn.org/go/cpt)

reasonCode.description: Reason the encounter takes place, expressed as a code.

location.description: List of locations where the patient has been during this encounter. References the Location resource.

type.text: INSERTION OF NON-TUNNELED CENTRALLY INSERTED CENTRAL VENOUS CATHETER; AGE 5 YEARS OR OLDER
RADIOLOGIC EXAMINATION, CHEST; SINGLE VIEW
RADIOLOGIC EXAMINATION, ABDOMEN; 1 VIEW

ULTRASOUND GUIDANCE FOR VASCULAR ACCESS REQUIRING ULTRASOUND EVALUATION OF POTENTIAL ACCESS SITES, DOCUMENTATION OF SELECTED VESSEL PATENCY, CONCURRENT REALTIME ULTRASOUND VISUALIZATION OF VASCULAR NEEDLE ENTRY, WITH PERMANENT RECORDING AND REPORTING (LIST SEPARATELY IN ADDITION TO CODE FOR PRIMARY PROCEDURE)

THERAPEUTIC INTERVENTIONS THAT FOCUS ON COGNITIVE FUNCTION (EG, ATTENTION, MEMORY, REASONING, EXECUTIVE FUNCTION, PROBLEM SOLVING, AND/OR PRAGMATIC FUNCTIONING) AND COMPENSATORY STRATEGIES TO MANAGE THE PERFORMANCE OF AN ACTIVITY (EG, MANAGING TIME OR SCHEDULES, INITIATING, ORGANIZING, AND SEQUENCING TASKS), DIRECT (ONE-ON-ONE) PATIENT CONTACT; INITIAL 15 MINUTES

PHYSICAL THERAPY EVALUATION: LOW COMPLEXITY, REQUIRING THESE COMPONENTS: A HISTORY WITH NO PERSONAL FACTORS AND/OR COMORBIDITIES THAT IMPACT THE PLAN OF CARE; AN EXAMINATION OF BODY SYSTEM(S) USING STANDARDIZED TESTS AND MEASURES ADDRESSING 1-2 ELEMENTS FROM ANY OF THE FOLLOWING: BODY STRUCTURES AND FUNCTIONS, ACTIVITY LIMITATIONS, AND/OR PARTICIPATION RESTRICTIONS; A CLINICAL PRESENTATION WITH STABLE AND/OR UNCOMPLICATED CHARACTERISTICS; AND CLINICAL DECISION MAKING OF LOW COMPLEXITY USING STANDARDIZED PATIENT ASSESSMENT INSTRUMENT AND/OR MEASURABLE ASSESSMENT OF FUNCTIONAL OUTCOME. TYPICALLY, 20 MINUTES ARE SPENT FACE-TO-FACE WITH THE PATIENT AND/OR FAMILY.

OCCUPATIONAL THERAPY EVALUATION, LOW COMPLEXITY, REQUIRING THESE COMPONENTS: AN OCCUPATIONAL PROFILE AND MEDICAL AND THERAPY HISTORY, WHICH INCLUDES A BRIEF HISTORY INCLUDING REVIEW OF MEDICAL AND/OR THERAPY RECORDS RELATING TO THE PRESENTING PROBLEM; AN ASSESSMENT(S) THAT IDENTIFIES 1-3 PERFORMANCE DEFICITS (IE, RELATING TO PHYSICAL, COGNITIVE, OR PSYCHOSOCIAL SKILLS) THAT RESULT IN ACTIVITY LIMITATIONS AND/OR PARTICIPATION RESTRICTIONS; AND CLINICAL DECISION MAKING OF LOW COMPLEXITY, WHICH INCLUDES AN ANALYSIS OF THE OCCUPATIONAL PROFILE, ANALYSIS OF DATA FROM PROBLEM-FOCUSED ASSESSMENT(S), AND CONSIDERATION OF A LIMITED NUMBER OF TREATMENT OPTIONS. PATIENT PRESENTS WITH NO COMORBIDITIES THAT AFFECT OCCUPATIONAL PERFORMANCE. MODIFICATION OF TASKS OR ASSISTANCE (EG, PHYSICAL OR VERBAL) WITH ASSESSMENT(S) IS NOT NECESSARY TO ENABLE COMPLETION OF EVALUATION COMPONENT. TYPICALLY, 30 MINUTES ARE SPENT FACE-TO-FACE WITH THE PATIENT AND/OR FAMILY.
THERAPEUTIC ACTIVITIES, DIRECT (ONE-ON-ONE) PATIENT CONTACT (USE OF DYNAMIC ACTIVITIES TO IMPROVE FUNCTIONAL PERFORMANCE), EACH 15 MINUTES

OFFICE OR OTHER OUTPATIENT VISIT FOR THE EVALUATION AND MANAGEMENT OF AN ESTABLISHED PATIENT, WHICH REQUIRES A MEDICALLY APPROPRIATE HISTORY AND/OR EXAMINATION AND LOW LEVEL OF MEDICAL DECISION MAKING. WHEN USING TIME FOR CODE SELECTION, 20-29 MINUTES OF TOTAL TIME IS SPENT ON THE DATE OF THE ENCOUNTER.

INITIAL HOSPITAL CARE, PER DAY, FOR THE EVALUATION AND MANAGEMENT OF A PATIENT, WHICH REQUIRES THESE 3 KEY COMPONENTS: A COMPREHENSIVE HISTORY; A COMPREHENSIVE EXAMINATION; AND MEDICAL DECISION MAKING OF MODERATE COMPLEXITY. COUNSELING AND/OR COORDINATION OF CARE WITH OTHER PHYSICIANS, OTHER QUALIFIED HEALTH CARE PROFESSIONALS, OR AGENCIES ARE PROVIDED CONSISTENT WITH THE NATURE OF THE PROBLEM(S) AND THE PATIENT'S AND/OR FAMILY'S NEEDS. USUALLY, THE PROBLEM(S) REQUIRING ADMISSION ARE OF MODERATE SEVERITY. TYPICALLY, 50 MINUTES ARE SPENT AT THE BEDSIDE AND ON THE PATIENT'S HOSPITAL FLOOR OR UNIT.
HOSPITAL DISCHARGE DAY MANAGEMENT; 30 MINUTES OR LESS
INSERTION OF NON-TUNNELED CENTRALLY INSERTED CENTRAL VENOUS CATHETER; AGE 5 YEARS OR OLDER
RADIOLOGIC EXAMINATION, CHEST; SINGLE VIEW
RADIOLOGIC EXAMINATION, ABDOMEN; 1 VIEW

ULTRASOUND GUIDANCE FOR VASCULAR ACCESS REQUIRING ULTRASOUND EVALUATION OF POTENTIAL ACCESS SITES, DOCUMENTATION OF SELECTED VESSEL PATENCY, CONCURRENT REALTIME ULTRASOUND VISUALIZATION OF VASCULAR NEEDLE ENTRY, WITH PERMANENT RECORDING AND REPORTING (LIST SEPARATELY IN ADDITION TO CODE FOR PRIMARY PROCEDURE)

THERAPEUTIC INTERVENTIONS THAT FOCUS ON COGNITIVE FUNCTION (EG, ATTENTION, MEMORY, REASONING, EXECUTIVE FUNCTION, PROBLEM SOLVING, AND/OR PRAGMATIC FUNCTIONING) AND COMPENSATORY STRATEGIES TO MANAGE THE PERFORMANCE OF AN ACTIVITY (EG, MANAGING TIME OR SCHEDULES, INITIATING, ORGANIZING, AND SEQUENCING TASKS), DIRECT (ONE-ON-ONE) PATIENT CONTACT; INITIAL 15 MINUTES

PHYSICAL THERAPY EVALUATION: LOW COMPLEXITY, REQUIRING THESE COMPONENTS: A HISTORY WITH NO PERSONAL FACTORS AND/OR COMORBIDITIES THAT IMPACT THE PLAN OF CARE; AN EXAMINATION OF BODY SYSTEM(S) USING STANDARDIZED TESTS AND MEASURES ADDRESSING 1-2 ELEMENTS FROM ANY OF THE FOLLOWING: BODY STRUCTURES AND FUNCTIONS, ACTIVITY LIMITATIONS, AND/OR PARTICIPATION RESTRICTIONS; A CLINICAL PRESENTATION WITH STABLE AND/OR UNCOMPLICATED CHARACTERISTICS; AND CLINICAL DECISION MAKING OF LOW COMPLEXITY USING STANDARDIZED PATIENT ASSESSMENT INSTRUMENT AND/OR MEASURABLE ASSESSMENT OF FUNCTIONAL OUTCOME. TYPICALLY, 20 MINUTES ARE SPENT FACE-TO-FACE WITH THE PATIENT AND/OR FAMILY.

OCCUPATIONAL THERAPY EVALUATION, LOW COMPLEXITY, REQUIRING THESE COMPONENTS: AN OCCUPATIONAL PROFILE AND MEDICAL AND THERAPY HISTORY, WHICH INCLUDES A BRIEF HISTORY INCLUDING REVIEW OF MEDICAL AND/OR THERAPY RECORDS RELATING TO THE PRESENTING PROBLEM; AN ASSESSMENT(S) THAT IDENTIFIES 1-3 PERFORMANCE DEFICITS (IE, RELATING TO PHYSICAL, COGNITIVE, OR PSYCHOSOCIAL SKILLS) THAT RESULT IN ACTIVITY LIMITATIONS AND/OR PARTICIPATION RESTRICTIONS; AND CLINICAL DECISION MAKING OF LOW COMPLEXITY, WHICH INCLUDES AN ANALYSIS OF THE OCCUPATIONAL PROFILE, ANALYSIS OF DATA FROM PROBLEM-FOCUSED ASSESSMENT(S), AND CONSIDERATION OF A LIMITED NUMBER OF TREATMENT OPTIONS. PATIENT PRESENTS WITH NO COMORBIDITIES THAT AFFECT OCCUPATIONAL PERFORMANCE. MODIFICATION OF TASKS OR ASSISTANCE (EG, PHYSICAL OR VERBAL) WITH ASSESSMENT(S) IS NOT NECESSARY TO ENABLE COMPLETION OF EVALUATION COMPONENT. TYPICALLY, 30 MINUTES ARE SPENT FACE-TO-FACE WITH THE PATIENT AND/OR FAMILY.
THERAPEUTIC ACTIVITIES, DIRECT (ONE-ON-ONE) PATIENT CONTACT (USE OF DYNAMIC ACTIVITIES TO IMPROVE FUNCTIONAL PERFORMANCE), EACH 15 MINUTES

OFFICE OR OTHER OUTPATIENT VISIT FOR THE EVALUATION AND MANAGEMENT OF AN ESTABLISHED PATIENT, WHICH REQUIRES A MEDICALLY APPROPRIATE HISTORY AND/OR EXAMINATION AND LOW LEVEL OF MEDICAL DECISION MAKING. WHEN USING TIME FOR CODE SELECTION, 20-29 MINUTES OF TOTAL TIME IS SPENT ON THE DATE OF THE ENCOUNTER.

INITIAL HOSPITAL CARE, PER DAY, FOR THE EVALUATION AND MANAGEMENT OF A PATIENT, WHICH REQUIRES THESE 3 KEY COMPONENTS: A COMPREHENSIVE HISTORY; A COMPREHENSIVE EXAMINATION; AND MEDICAL DECISION MAKING OF MODERATE COMPLEXITY. COUNSELING AND/OR COORDINATION OF CARE WITH OTHER PHYSICIANS, OTHER QUALIFIED HEALTH CARE PROFESSIONALS, OR AGENCIES ARE PROVIDED CONSISTENT WITH THE NATURE OF THE PROBLEM(S) AND THE PATIENT'S AND/OR FAMILY'S NEEDS. USUALLY, THE PROBLEM(S) REQUIRING ADMISSION ARE OF MODERATE SEVERITY. TYPICALLY, 50 MINUTES ARE SPENT AT THE BEDSIDE AND ON THE PATIENT'S HOSPITAL FLOOR OR UNIT.
HOSPITAL DISCHARGE DAY MANAGEMENT; 30 MINUTES OR LESS

ImmunizationProtocolApplied.description: The protocol, or set of recommendations, being followed by the provider who administered the dose.

ImmunizationReaction.description: Categorical data indicating that an adverse event is associated in time to an immunization.

identifier.description: Unique code or number identifying the location to its users. [View the naming system for VA clinics.](https://api.va.gov/services/fhir/v0/r4/NamingSystem/va-clinic-identifier)

status.description: The status property covers the general availability of the resource, not the current value which may be covered by the operationStatus, or by a schedule/slots if they are configured for the location. [View location status code system.](http://hl7.org/fhir/location-status)

name.description: Commonly-known name of the location. Does not need to be unique.

description.description: Description of the location, which helps in finding or referencing the place.

mode.description: Indicates whether a resource instance represents a specific location or a class of locations.

type.description: Indicates the type of function performed at the location.

telecom.description: The contact details of communication devices available at the location. This can include phone numbers, fax numbers, mobile numbers, email addresses and websites.

type.text: OUTPATIENT CLINIC
OUTPATIENT CLINIC

id.description: The Medication resource FHIR _id as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

dosageInstruction.text: TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY DAY
TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY DAY

status.description: A code specifying the current state of the order. Generally, this will be active or completed state. [View status request codes.](http://hl7.org/fhir/CodeSystem/medicationrequest-status)

intent.description: Whether the request is a proposal, plan, or an original order. [View medication request intents.](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/valueset-medicationrequest-intent.html)

reportedBoolean.description: Indicates if this record was captured as a secondary 'reported' record rather than as an original and primary source-of-truth record.

authoredOn.description: The date and sometimes time when the prescription was initially written or authored on.

note.description: Extra information about the prescription that could not be conveyed by the other attributes.

dosageInstruction.description: Indicates how the medication is to be used by the patient.

lastUpdated.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

status.description: The status of the result value.

category.description: A code that classifies the general type of observation being made. [View the observation category codes.](http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/observation-category)

effectiveDateTime.description: The time or time-period the observed value is asserted as being true.

issued.description: The date and time this version of the observation was made available to providers, typically after the results have been reviewed and verified.

performer.description: Who was responsible for asserting the observed value as true. References the Organization resource.

details.text: This request can not be processed

extension.description: Concepts classifying the person into a named category of humans sharing common history, traits, geographical origin or nationality. View the FHIR structure definitions for [US Core race](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/StructureDefinition-us-core-race), [US Core ethnicity](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/StructureDefinition-us-core-ethnicity), or [US Core birth sex.](http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/StructureDefinition/us-core-birthsex)

name.description: A name associated with the individual.

telecom.description: A contact detail, such as a telephone number or an email address, by which the individual may be contacted.

gender.description: Administrative Gender - the gender that the patient is considered to have for administration and record keeping purposes.

birthDate.description: The date of birth for the individual.

deceasedBoolean.description: Indicates if the individual is deceased or not.

contact.description: A contact party such as a guardian, partner, or friend for the patient.

PatientContact.description: A contact party such as a guardian, partner, or friend for the patient.

identifier.description: An identifier that applies to this person in this role. Supported systems are: [VA.gov MPI](http://va.gov/mpi), [FHIR US SSN](http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/us-ssn ), and [FHIR v2 0203.](http://hl7.org/fhir/v2/0203)

active.description: Whether this practitioner's record is in active use.

name.description: The name or names associated with the practitioner.

telecom.description: A contact detail for the practitioner such as a telephone number or an email address.

address.description: Addresses of the practitioner that are not role specific.

gender.description: Administrative gender - the gender that the person is considered to have for administration and record keeping purposes.

birthDate.description: The date of birth for the practitioner.

qualification.description: The official certifications, training, and licenses that authorize or otherwise pertain to the provision of care by the practitioner.

PractitionerQualification.description: The official certifications, training, and licenses that authorize or otherwise pertain to the provision of care by the practitioner.

active.description: Whether this practitioner role record is in active use.

code.description: Roles which this practitioner is authorized to perform for the organization.

location.description: The location(s) at which this practitioner provides care. References the Location resource.

healthcareService.description: The list of healthcare services that this worker provides for this role's Organization/Location(s).

telecom.description: Contact details that are specific to the role/location/service.
